sen.j: 御恩と奉公（ごおんとほうこう）とは、中世日本において、主に武士の主従関係を構成した要素・概念。
sen.e: Goon and hoko indicate factors and concepts that constituted the master-servant relationships among samurai in the medieval Japan.

sen.j: 中世の武士間の主従関係は、決して片務的なものではなく、主人・従者が相互に利益を与え合う互恵的な関係で成り立っていた。
sen.e: The master-servant relationships among samurai in the medieval period were not one-sided but were established based on mutually beneficial ones in which benefits were not only given by a mater and received by his servant but also given by a servant and received by the master.

sen.e: When the Kamakura bakufu was established, gokenin played, for the Kamakura-dono, the economical roles as samurai, called Kanto-mikuji, in addition to the services of military roles, such as military roles in emergency, the Oban-yaku role for guarding the imperial court and bakufu, the Ikoku keigo ban-yaku role (the role for guarding against attacks from foreign countries) and the Nagato keigo ban-yaku role (also the role for guarding against attacks from foreign countries at a station placed in Nagato, present Yamaguchi Prefecture).
